cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW, expected to cross Cuba, enter the Florida Straits, make landfall along Florida’s west coast, then curve NE-N along the U.S. Southeast coast toward the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast near the Big Bend / Cedar Key area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cayman Brac and Little Cayman; Cuban provinces of Matanzas, Mayabeque, and Havana; Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Southern Haiti (Port-au-Prince to the DR border), Jamaica, and the Cuban provinces of Camaguey eastward to Guantanamo
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Jamaica, southern Hispaniola, Cuba, the Florida Keys and peninsula, coastal Georgia and the Carolinas, and the Mid-Atlantic coast (including Virginia)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Thursday night into Friday with peak sustained winds 25–35 mph and higher gusts as the center passes nearby; chance of tropical-storm-force winds is 9%
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (generally <2 ft) possible in the lower Chesapeake Bay and adjacent tidal rivers, depending on exact track and tide cycle
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain likely with locally higher amounts, which could cause ponding on terminals and minor flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado risk in outer rain bands cannot be ruled out late Thursday–Friday
